Reviews.Content: Absolutely hated this placed! DO NOT STAY HERE! When you read the other reviews you will see that the hotel is old, tired and badly in need of renovations. Our room was on the 4th floor, had salt damp in the walls of the room, water damage on the floor, bathroom very old and dirty, smelt like it had not been cleaned for a year. The breakfast was awful, okay if you like omeletes or fried eggs but apart from that only noodles, rice, stir fried veggies and meat, not my choice for breakfast. There was bread and croissants but so many people staying there did not use the tongs and were loading up their plates with 15 to 20 of these pastries, obviously to take back to the room.....no manners whatsoever.Went down to the pool on first day, could not get a chair either on the beach or by the pool, looks like people get down there early in the morning and place towels on the chairs. Went and asked a staff member if they had more chairs and they looked at me like I was stupid! Ended up going out for the day for the Nusa Dua Beach Cafe, near Nikko Hotel at Nusa Dua, spent the whole day there on the beach with a free lounge chair and umbrella as we had lunch at the cafe. This place is brilliant and just such a beautiful beach, fantastic food and soo cheap compared to the prices you would pay in a resort. Every day we went out as we could not bear to stay in the revolting smelly hotel, supposed to be 5 stars but I would only give it 2 and that is being generous.If eating out in Nusa Dua I would recommend going to Bualu Village for dinner, so many nice restaurants, Nyomans, La Laguna and Chees Bar; these places are so cheap, half the price of what you would pay in the resorts for food and drink. Another beautiful place to spend the day is Tao's at Benoa, part of the Ramada Hotel but anyone can go there, use the pool with towels and have a beautiful lunch, watersports, etc.After having travelling extensively, and returning to Bali for my 15th time I would never again stay at Nusa Dua, this is not the real Bali, my recommendation would be to stay at Sanur and Ubud, you can stay at fabulous accommodation for less than half the price you would pay in Nusa Dua.
Reviews.Author: GOOLIEGIRL10

Reviews.Content: Make your vacation up sad It was a very old and terrible room I ever seen. There was odd smell in the washroom. You could find the dirty on the towel . There was odd smell on the pillow. When you took the shower, the water just ran into the drain but on the other way the dirty water flood on the washroom floor. The shower water was just warm. It made me feel up sad on my vacation. You want to know how worse it is? My comment is Stay in this hotel even worse than you stay home.
Reviews.Author: giegie999

Reviews.Content: Not as bad a expected       Nusa Dua beach
Reviews.Author: molly75

Reviews.Content: Loved it either we went to this hotel when it was having a good few days or my version of quality, service and value for money is alot different to others!! i loved loved loved this place! all the secrurity scared the hell out of me when we first arrived but as the days went by we actually made good friends with all of them. we had booked the delux sea view but apparently there was a spare garden cottage so they upgraded us :) i highly recomend the cottages as they are just beautiful, room service is very good. the restraunts there are brilliant not to expensive compared to some other places in nusa dua. the beach is magnificent, very clean. yes some of the hotel is a little old and run down but if u can look beyond that you will find that this is a magnificent paridise filled with friendly staff.
Reviews.Author: kristylea88

Reviews.Content: Not on Par with the location We booked a 3 week holiday to Bali, we got a last minute deal with flights and hotel for less than the flights itself, therefore we were not bothered about the hotel as we had intended traveling around the island anyway.This hotel is very out dated and leaves itself down in many areas. The other hotels in the resort are 5 star luxurious hotels. This hotel in its day was beautiful but it has had little repair or upkeep in the last few years.The rooms are basic but spacious, although slightly mould. The ground are nice but again in need of repair. I would not stay at this hotel again. It served it purpose as a base while we traveled around bali but out of 3 weeks we only slept in the hotel on 6 nights.We reported a broken railing in the swimming pool which was rusted through and would fall on someone swimming very shortly . It was not just a small rail it was a large centre piece which divided the main pool from the kiddies pool, it really was very dangerous especially as there were many kids playing around it. No one had any interest in what i had to say, After reporting it on many occasions i gave up as it was obvious they would not repair it.
Reviews.Author: mymemory

Reviews.Content: If you have to stay here, you shouldn't go. This Hotel is about 30 years off the pace. It is tired and in very poor condition. Photographs on the web site make it look ok, but the rooms are tired and poorly maintained, smelly from mould and poor ventilation and the furniture is the original from when if opened 20 or 30 years ago. The place is falling down, lifts dont work, wiring and light switches are broken and very unsafe and the bathrooms are patched up with silicone and cement.Tiles are falling off the pool and the facilities are non existent. Theoritically there is a tennis court, ask to see it and staff will direct you to the rear of the building near the service are where there is mounds of putrid rubbish and the court can't be used anyway. The first thing all the locals say is that it is owned by the government and therefore not very good. They weren't wrong. Everyone is friendly enough, but ask for something simple like and they don't turn up and you need to ask three times.Stay home you'll have more fun.
Reviews.Author: dwhmelb

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't recommend Myself and my boyfriend booked this holiday via a website as quite a late deal. When we arrived we were quite surprised to find the room to be quite a lot mroe basic than we had thought it would be. The rooms are clearly old and in need of an update but we knew this before we went but honestly the bathroom looked like it had been fitted in the 70s and that the cleaners maybe gave it a wipe and that was about it as it was very brown and marked all over the place (and from speaking to others ours sounded like one of the better looking rooms!) The bed was comfy enough but we had 2 geckos in the room for the whole two weeks we were staying there which kept us awake each and every night and were impossible to get rid of. We also recieved 5 - 6 phone calls to our room in the first 10 days we stayed there from timeshare companies selling us other holidays etc who we really had to get aggressive with before they would stop calling us (in my view in other hotels this is probably stopped at reception but the receptionists at the Inna Putri Bali don't really seem to care too much). We also tried to arrange to have our room a little longer or to have access to a courtesy room on the last day we left (as we weren't going to the airport until 4pm). The hotel said we could not keep our room but said that we didn't have to be out of it until 12 noon although the cleaners knocked on the door every 5 minutes from 11am until we left! They also laughed when we asked if we could have access to a courtesy room and looked at us like we were stupid. Thankfully we met another couple who were staying there and could use their room for a shower etc but I think this is something to bear in mind if you have a really late flight out (which thankfully we didn't!) Overall we had a good 2 weeks in Bali despite all the problems mentioned above at the hotel (and there are more I haven't covered). I would recommend going to the Ritz Spa if anyone is into their Spas as a day here is amazing and the Thalasso Pool is worth the 拢30 odd that you pay for 2 hours in it. The main general point I would make about Bali is that it looks beautiful and is beautiful photograph wise but I wouldn't go again. You have to pay for a visa on the way in and then also pay an amount to leave at the airport too. You will, I guarantee, be hassled like you have never been hassled before when you are there - for us this was by the hotel staff, the taxis outside the hotel and basically anyone Balinese you come into contact with! The taxi drivers are a complete pain and because there are so many of them you can't escape them. If I was ever to go to Bali again I would ensure I didn't stay in the Inna Putri Bali and would probably not stay in Nusa Dua as it seems to be targeted by all companies in Bali because most of the tourists to Bali stay there.The couple we met while there were staying in Bali for a month and honestly said to us that they were jealous of us when we were heading home as the amount of hassle you get from everyone does your head in!
Reviews.Author: lancashire_lass27

Reviews.Content: Don't even think to stay there!!!       the floor of our updated room
Reviews.Author: elenabgr

Reviews.Content: good but in need of updating The Inna Putri Bali is right next to Nusa Dua beach.The room we stayed in was clean but in need of repairs, the bath leaked, there was a problem with the electricity and there were ants in the bathroom.For all the time we were in the hotel room it was OK. A lot of the staff do not speak English but are friendly.The pool was good and kept fairly clean - watch out for big red ants, they bite!!If you stay here don't bother eating or drinking in Bali Collection - Jump in a taxi (don't pay any more than 70,000 rupiah) and go to Kuta for dinner. It's much busier and a LOT cheaper than eating out in Nusa Dua.Watch out for the staff at the hotel selling what you may think are cheap cigarattes and fake watches - if you want these things you can get them cheaper in Kuta.Finally - if you have booked a transfer to and from the airport through your travel agent you will need to spell it out to the staff at the hotel - we did but they still wanted to charge us.Overall - a great holiday, the putri bali could be really nice just needs smartening up.
Reviews.Author: Clarrabella

Reviews.Content: Good location rooms needs updating We have just returned from a two weeks stay at this hotel on 18th May 2008. It is right on the beach and on a good location. The beach is good. The staff are great and helpful. The rooms are ok but dated. We found ants and on reporting they came and spayed. The ants came in a few times. Once a cockroach also! However we told the maid to spray everyday and they did. The a/c doesn't work well. The rooms with sea view which we had are obstructed with the palm trees. There are two locations where you can walk to within 7-10mins; Bali collection and the village. Food at the village is cheaper than at Bali collection. Resturants provide a pickup and dropoff service free if you want. In the village there is a German owned resturant which is great. Kuta is about 20mins drive. Private taxi from outside the hotel will cost 100 rupees return. They will drop and pick you up and pay the full amount on the return journey. They will quote over 200 rupees but when you walk away they will call you back. A trip to Kintamani will start from 300rupees and it is well worth it.
Reviews.Author: hashLondon

Reviews.Content: if you plan to go there !!!!!!! a big big hotel,but only two elevators were working !! my room 4063 so on the 4 th level ! the AC is just working ! on breakfast no sausages no bacon before 9 am!! and if you dream of marvellous sea and beaches: so many plastic dishes and eveything else on the sand ! rubish!! never stay there again !!
Reviews.Author: domzai

Reviews.Content: Location Lovely, hotel a bit sad We have stayed at the Putri Nusa Dua each year since 2004.Was there in January this year and although we love the location and the staff and groundstaff aare great the hotel itself is badly in need of repairs and renovations. It is sad that such a lovely setting is getting spoilt because of the lack of maintenance to this lovely old resort. Management need to take a good look at themselves and maybe do some restoration work before it falls further into disrepair
Reviews.Author: denjan28

Reviews.Content: you pay for ehat you get I have read alot of reviews on here about the hotel and agree with pretty much all of them.The hotel is dated and in need of some TLCThe staff are good on the whole, although why they need to change the towels twice a day is beyond me.The pool area and beach is good, its clean, well tendered to and they cleaned the beach of seaweed every morning unlike at the hotels either side.The breakfast is ok, at best, but i and my partner aint big into breakfast.The rooms are clean and adequete.On the whole our time at the inna was ok, it is in need of a big upgrade, as its neighbors are big chain hotels that are indeed much better, but they are much more expensive, if you can get a deal on them then fair enough, however as we spent most of our days on the beach it didn`t matter too much.If you can get the inna at a cheap price, take it.Outside.The food at the beach bar is expensive by comparison, but if you walk along the beach (turn right if you looking at the sea) there is a beachfront cafe that serves a really nice tuna mayo sandwich and chips for about a 拢1 and a beer for half that, just the job at lunchtime.Bali collection- is a mix of shopping, eating and drinking and is a short walk away from the hotel, is has the usual stuff.The old street is where we ate most nights, the food at nearly all was good to excellent, our particular favorite was the laguna garden and the beef rendang was the best meal i had on holiday, the only place i`d avoid was the first restaurant on the left handside as you walk up the street (can`t remember the name, but its was next to the closed down bar!!)I would not advise booking tours etc with the agents in the hotels, they want to charge you $70+pp for the elephant park, and $110 pp for an island tour. We paid $20pp for a day around the island and $15 pp for the day out at the elephant park and that included the lunch buffet!! and we had the airconditioned transport to ourselves, any of the guys will do the trips for you that wait outside any hotel, book em, we had no problems, infact it was great to have the driver to yourself as you can stop anyhwere, anytime and get those photos.If you want to be pampered in a swish hotel and don`t mind paying for it, don`t go to the puti bali, however if you want a clean low budget hotel in a cracking spot on the beach, within walking distance of shops, bars and restaurants then book itBy the way ask for mumbal at the laguna graden, he`s usually behind the bar, ask him if he likes watching the tom hanks film the green mile, then say martin and sharon say hello!!
Reviews.Author: clayxblade

Reviews.Content: In need of an overhaul The hotel needs some renovations. Probably a good hotel in the 70s and 80s but the rooms are dated and furnishings suffering from wear and tear. Staff are fine, the restaurant is very basic so don't expect anything special. It is on the beachfront but you do need to be a good swimmer as the currents are strong here and waves are rough. The pool is nice and offers a good alternative to the beach. However it is cheap to stay here so if you pay those prices you can't expect a great place.
Reviews.Author: Dubliner

Reviews.Content: inna putri review Just returned from 11 nights at the Inna Putri. The hotel has been very grand in its day but is now a bit run down. It is still a really great place to stay the rooms are fine, plenty of room, the bathrooms need a bit of fixing up but adequate. My husband  I had one room and our 2 teenage children had their own interconnecting room which worked really well. We were on the ground floor and opened onto a beautiful garden.The buffet breakfast which was included for us was really fine. The staff were great, nothing too much trouble and the girls who do the manicure and pedicure, hair braiding are very talented and reasonably priced. The pool area is large and very nice and there are plenty of deck chairs for relaxing on the beach under the trees. The beach is nice for swimming and a short boat ride out for some great surf. 5 mins walk away is the Bali Collection a great place to eat, lots of restaurants and shops, also a supermarket that sells everthing. Overall great value for money.
Reviews.Author: vfj

Reviews.Content: Horrible experience It's bad enough that the room service is bad where the two rooms we had was not consistent, some didn't have the bath robes and the cups were not even washed and changed daily. also ceiling was leaking when it rained making the floor so wet and slippery and most of the details in the room was already spoiled and probably not taken care of. 5 stars - nah... just because they are a government hotel - so is the Grand Bali and the Inna Bali in Kuta, hence they are the so called appointed and labeled hotels for most group tourist. The breakfast sucks and there was no meat at all out of 2 days we stayed and only 1 day they did serve and that was also after the eggs sort of finished out.
Reviews.Author: yvonnece

Reviews.Content: cheap hotel - don't expect too much Stayed 10 days. Rooms ok, but service not so good, although they clean and change towels twice per day, it took them 2 days to clean bird crap on the balcony. Food in the hotel is not good- not fresh - so we spend most of time in a shoppig/restaurant complex nearby which was excellent and cheaper then the hotel restaurants. Beach is very nice, but due to high tide a lot of garbage is on the shore, though they clean it, the beach is not clean as in other better/more expensive hotels. Hotel is very quiet and dark, a bit spooky. Not many activities in the hotel. Would not go there again. Marijana  Tanja, Serbia
Reviews.Author: Two4fun_bg

Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel There is not much to say other than the best week on holiday I have visited. It is truly beautiful, nice views and wonderfull food. The hotel has beautiful marble floors and the design is classic indonisia.
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlSA

Reviews.Content: old hotel urgently need some renovations We stayed at the beach front cottage, arrived there late in the afternoon to find out that the aircond was leaking, some of the light bulbs burnt out. The housekeeping staffs arrived in 15-30minutes, it took 1 hour to fix them all, so we had company while my husband and I watching tv. The cottage has 2 stories, below is the bedroom and bathroom, and one room upstairs, we didnt use the upstair room. I think the room is ok, but a bit dark, with heavy traditional design, unique wooden door and small wooden windows. Unlike in Kuta Paradiso, I loved the bathroom here, it has a big bathtub and a open air garden shower facing the sea.This is a very big hotel with lots of rooms and cottages, this hotel is beautifully designed, with game room, pizzeria, beautiful gardens and great pool.I waited for the sun rise on the beach, which was an amazing experience.The staff were proactive and friendly
Reviews.Author: j-lho

Reviews.Content: Not worth the money       Overgrown grass, rusty lamp and moss covered stonewall
Reviews.Author: mundgen

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! I really enjoyed my stay at Putri Bali. The price was good. The room was very nice  clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was right next to the beach and the pool was nice. I loved the breakfast buffet. The only negative is the hotel is a bit too quiet. Not many people staying there. Some people may prefer quiet hotels though. I would stay here again!
Reviews.Author: softiegal

Reviews.Content: with this price , well acceptable we went there for a 4 days trip. The hotel is kind of out of trend compare to other hotels nearby, although the services are not bad,one thing needs to be aware of is the flodding-in tour groups!!That will kill all your mood away! So I'd suggest if you want to have a high-quality vacation, this isn't an appropriate place. Yet for the price, it'll be a good reason to choose this hotel.
Reviews.Author: ontheroadTp

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Spa Experience Hotel is a bit worn but rooms were clean. I liked the pool, which is just a few metres away from the beach. Breakfast menu could be a little more varied. Staff was friendly. It was supposed to be high season but still the hotel was still quiet. Spa experience was wonderful! A must-try. Good value - I'd certainly come back to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Eerily quiet
Reviews.Author: m888han
